Description: Carved object; ivory: five tiers depicting scenes and symbols of Christ: Nativity; St Anthony and St Paul in the desert; scenes of saints; sheep; peacocks; pelicans feeding young; fountain.
Curator's comments: Compare another in VAM shown in Baroque exhibition 2009, also VAM a-38-1921 and A 27-1984 for complete mounts (not as elaborate) with Christ as Good Shepherd on top. The ivory displays a combination of Chinese and Indian motifs. There is an element missing on top of the piece which is usually surmounted by a small figure of a child with his hand to his cheek and crossed legs.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 Jun 13-Aug 31, Glasgow, The Burrell Collection, 'Europe in India: Indian Paintings and their European prototypes'
Associated names: Representation of: St Paul the Hermit
Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: H J W Sargood
